Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.net

Class PublicKeyTrustManager

java.lang.Object
com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.net.PublicKeyTrustManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
TrustManager, X509TrustManager
public class PublicKeyTrustManager extends Object implements X509TrustManager
A trust manager that only trusts servers whose public key hashes are all in the list of trusted public key hashes. It also possible to provide a custom trust store or trust manager. When a valid KeyStore instance or X509TrustManager is provided, it will be used to validate the trust of the SSL certificate chain. When no instance is provided, the default system truststore is used to validate the trust of the SSL certificate chain.

  • Constructor Details

    • PublicKeyTrustManager

      public PublicKeyTrustManager(String[] publicKeyHashes)
      Constructs a trust manager with an array of trusted public key hashes.

      The default system store is used to check the trust of the certificate chain.

      Parameters:
      publicKeyHashes - The array of public key hashes. Every string is the SHA-256 hash of a public key that is trusted and contains 32 bytes.

    • PublicKeyTrustManager

      public PublicKeyTrustManager(String[] publicKeyHashes, KeyStore trustedStore)
      Constructs a trust manager with an array of trusted public key hashes and a trusted certificate store.
      Parameters:
      publicKeyHashes - The array of public key hashes. Every string is the SHA-256 hash of a public key that is trusted and contains 32 bytes.
      trustedStore - A user specified KeyStore instance used to validate the chain of trust.

    • PublicKeyTrustManager

      public PublicKeyTrustManager(String[] publicKeyHashes, X509TrustManager trustManager)
      Constructs a trust manager with an array of trusted public key hashes and a custom X509TrustManager instance.
      Parameters:
      publicKeyHashes - The array of public key hashes. Every string is the SHA-256 hash of a public key that is trusted and contains 32 bytes.
      trustManager - A user specified X509TrustManager instance used to validate the chain of trust.

    • PublicKeyTrustManager

      public PublicKeyTrustManager(long[] publicKeyHashes)
      Constructs a trust manager with an array of trusted public key hashes.

      The default system store is used to check the trust of the certificate chain.

      Parameters:
      publicKeyHashes - The array of public key hashes. Every 4 longs are the SHA-256 hash of a public key that is trusted.

      public PublicKeyTrustManager(int[] publicKeyHashes)
      Constructs a trust manager with an array of trusted public key hashes.

      The default system store is used to check the trust of the certificate chain.

      Parameters:
      publicKeyHashes - The array of public key hashes. Every 8 integers are the SHA-256 hash of a public key that is trusted.

    • checkServerTrusted

      public void checkServerTrusted(X509Certificate[] chain, String authType, String hostName) throws CertificateException
      This method will be called by Android and allows us to make this X509TrustManager hostname-aware.
      Parameters:
      chain - ignored
      authType - ignored
      hostName - the hostname of the connection to be checked. The other checkServerTrusted method will be called later to actually verify the server,
      Throws:
      CertificateException
